instructions.display_text: Peel the kiwis, then, using a small knife, carefully cut small wedges lengthwise every ½ inch around each kiwi. Cut crosswise into ¼-inch-thick pieces to make flower-cut kiwi slices. Discard the scrap wedges.

Using a sharp knife, carefully slice off the top and bottom of the orange. Set the orange on a flat side and, working from top to bottom, slice the skin away from the flesh and discard, making sure to remove any remaining white pith. Cut between the membranes to release the orange segments, discarding the membrane.

Add the kiwi flowers and orange segments to a large bowl with the raspberries, blackberries, blueberries, grapes, strawberries, and cucumbers. Drizzle the Simple Truth™ Organic Lemon Turmeric Dressing over the fruit and gently toss to coat.
Garnish with the mint.
Enjoy!

½ cup Simple Truth™ Organic Mini Seedless Cucumbers, sliced into half-moons

recipes.name: Spicy Tomato, Cucumber, And Watermelon Salad

components.raw_text: 1 10-ounce container Simple Truth™ Organic Grape Tomatoes, thinly sliced crosswise
2 medium Simple Truth™ Organic Hass Avocados, peeled, pitted, and cut into 2-inch half-moons
components.extra_comment: peeled, pitted, and cut into 2 in (5 cm) half-moons

components.raw_text: 1 medium Simple Truth™ Cucumber, peeled and sliced into thin half moons
components.extra_comment: peeled and sliced into thin half moons

components.raw_text: ½ cup Simple Truth™ Rosemary Balsamic Salad Dressing

ingredient.name: Simple Truth™ Rosemary Balsamic Salad Dressing
ingredient.display_plural: Simple Truth™ Rosemary Balsamic Salad Dressings
ingredient.display_singular: Simple Truth™ Rosemary Balsamic Salad Dressing

components.raw_text: 2 tablespoons Simple Truth Roasted and Salted No Shell Pistachios, chopped

ingredient.display_plural: Simple Truth Roasted and Salted No Shell Pistachios
ingredient.display_singular: Simple Truth Roasted and Salted No Shell Pistachio
ingredient.name: Simple Truth Roasted and Salted No Shell Pistachios

components.raw_text: 2 tablespoons Simple Truth™ Organic Basil leaves
1 tablespoon chopped Simple Truth Organic Chives

instructions.display_text: Cut the watermelon in half crosswise, then cut off the rind. Slice the flesh into ½-inch-thick half-moons, then cut the half-moons into 2-inch triangles.
Transfer the watermelon to a large bowl and toss with the lime juice. Set aside for 5 minutes to soak.

Remove the watermelon from the bowl with the lime juice and arrange in a single layer on a serving platter. Top with the grape tomatoes, avocados, and cucumber, then drizzle with the Simple Truth™ Rosemary Balsamic Salad Dressing.
Scatter the jalapeño slices on top of the salad, then sprinkle with the flaky salt, pistachios, basil, and chives.
Enjoy!
Make the croutons: Preheat the oven to 325°F (160°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Tear the baguette into ½-inch pieces. You should have about 2 cups.
Add the bread pieces to a large bowl and toss with the lemon zest, garlic powder, and salt. Drizzle with the olive oil and toss to coat.
Spread the croutons in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet and toast, stirring halfway through, for 15–20 minutes, or until dried and starting to turn golden brown.
While the croutons toast, prepare the green beans: Bring a large pot of water to a boil over high heat and add the salt. Fill a large bowl with ice water.

Add the Simple Truth™ Organic Green Beans to the boiling water and cook for 4–6 minutes, until slightly tender, but still crisp. Drain the beans, then immediately transfer to the ice bath and let sit for 2 minutes, until cool. Transfer the green beans to a paper towel and pat dry.

Stack the green beans on a serving platter and drizzle with the Simple Truth™ Plant-Based Caesar Dressing. Sprinkle with the Simple Truth™ Organic Raw Pumpkin Seeds, the pepper, and reserved ½ teaspoon lemon zest. Top with the croutons and shaved Simple Truth™ Organic Aged Parmesan Cheese.
Enjoy!

components.raw_text: 2 tablespoon chopped Simple Truth™ Organic Cilantro leaves
2 tablespoon chopped Simple Truth™ Organic Basil leaves
½ cup Simple Truth™ Asian Style Sesame Vinaigrette

ingredient.display_plural: Simple Truth™ Asian Style Sesame Vinaigrettes
ingredient.display_singular: Simple Truth™ Asian Style Sesame Vinaigrette
ingredient.name: Simple Truth™ Asian Style Sesame Vinaigrette

instructions.display_text: Heat a small nonstick skillet medium heat. Add the sesame oil, ginger, and garlic and sauté for 1 minute, until fragrant. Add the brown sugar and water and stir until the sugar is dissolved and the mixture is bubbling, being careful not to let it burn. Fold in the peanuts and sesame seeds until well-coated in the sugar mixture. Remove the pan from the heat and set aside to cool for 10–15 minutes.

In a large serving bowl, combine the Simple Truth™ Organic Power Greens with Fresh Carrot, scallions, jalapeño, cilantro, and basil. Drizzle with the Simple Truth™ Asian Style Sesame Vinaigrette. Toss until the salad is well mixed and evenly coated.
Garnish with the glazed peanuts and sesame seeds.
Enjoy!

compilations.description: Are you team sweet or savory? Can't decide? Well, who said you can't have them both? These skillet recipes strike the perfect balance. Add a savory touch to your menu with the Turkey Biscuits Pot Pie. Then, balance your palate with a classic indulgence: our Skillet Brownie S'mores. Break out those skillets, you're going to need 'em! It's sizzling time.
compilations.name: Sweet Vs Savory Skillet Recipes

results.description: Homemade pizza is less than 30 minutes away with this easy, customizable recipe! Baking the pizza in a cast iron skillet ensures the crust holds its shape and gets nice and crispy on the bottom. Keep it simple with a sprinkle of cheese, or load up with your favorite toppings!

instructions.display_text: Preheat the oven to 500°F (260°C).
On a lightly floured surface, pat the dough into a disc, then stretch into a 10-inch circle.
Carefully transfer the pizza dough to a 10-inch cast iron skillet, making sure the edges of the pizza dough touch the edges of the pan.
Spread the pizza sauce on top of the dough, leaving a ¼-inch border. Top with shredded mozzarella and your toppings of choice.
Bake for 15 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown and the cheese is bubbling.
Carefully transfer the pizza to a cutting board, slice, and serve immediately.
Enjoy!

results.seo_title: Cast Iron Skillet Pizza Recipe by Tasty
results.name: Cast Iron Skillet Pizza

results.description: These turkey burgers are super versatile! Serve on buns with all of the classic fixings, or sub in your own favorite flavors (sun-dried tomatoes, spinach, and feta, anyone?). They also keep well in the fridge or freezer–make a double batch to keep on hand for easy protein to add to any meal!
results.name: Turkey Burgers

components.raw_text: ½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper

instructions.display_text: In a large bowl, combine the turkey, panko, mayonnaise, Worcestershire sauce, salt, and pepper, and mix with your hands until just evenly incorporated.
Divide the turkey mixture into 4 equal portions and shape into 4 patties.

Heat the canola oil in a large nonstick pan over medium-high heat. Once the oil begins to shimmer, add the patties and cook, without moving, until browned, 3–4 minutes. Carefully flip the patties and continue cooking until the burgers are cooked through and golden brown, or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F (75°C), 3–4 minutes more.
Serve the burgers on buns with ketchup, tomato, red onion, lettuce, and pickles, if desired.
Enjoy!

compilations.name: The Only Meal Prep Guide You Need To Follow
Low Calorie Dinners For The Week
5 Ingredient Recipes For An Entire Day
compilations.description: Got a hectic day ahead of you and don't have time for a grocery run? We've got your back with our 5-Ingredient Recipes. Bonus? They'll feed you for a whole day. Quell those lunchtime grumbles with our Chicken Pesto & Veggies. Oh, and don't forget to chase that down with a side of Brownies! That's right, you even get dessert. 5-ingredients but full of flavor, these recipes are here for you. Always.

Have a really busy week coming up? Well that's no excuse to not eat! We're here to fuel your mind, body, and soul, in the most delicious way possible. Our turkey taco bowl is delicious and will keep you filled up, and our vegetarian grain bowl is an ideal option for vegetarians and vegans. Don't sweat, we've got your back (and your rumbling tummy)!
compilations.name: How To Meal Prep
Easy Office Lunch Ideas!
compilations.description: Mornings are difficult enough without having to prepare lunch for the office. Here are a few quick, easy, and healthy lunch ideas for people who are always on the go. The Weekday Meal-Prep Chicken Burrito Bowls will save you time throughout the week! Make mornings ridiculously simple and nutritious with Microwave Prep Breakfast Sandwiches with ham or bacon.

compilations.name: Healthy Recipes for Your New Year's Resolutions
compilations.description: The new year is upon us and so is the time to make some choices in life. Let’s make a resolution to enter 2023 with healthier habits. From Weekday Meal-Prep Pesto Chicken & Veggies to a Berry Smoothie Bowl, we have got your culinary pact covered.

results.keywords: chicken, green beans, meal-prep, one-pan, pesto, tomatoes, veggies
results.name: Weekday Meal-Prep Pesto Chicken & Veggies

instructions.display_text: In a large pan, heat olive oil and add chicken thighs.
Season with salt and pepper. When the chicken is completely cooked through, remove from pan.
Slice into strips, and set aside.
Add green beans and cook until crisp tender.
Return the chicken strips to the pan, then add tomatoes and pesto. Stir until fully incorporated.
Serve immediately or divide into 4 food storage containers and store in the refrigerator. Can be kept refrigerated for up to 4 days.
Enjoy!
